required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Minimally Invasive Flap With Platelet Rich Fibrin or Growth Factor Enhanced Matrix in Treatment of Intrabony Defect
clinical_study.official_title: Intrabony Defects Management Using Growth Factor Enhanced Matrix Versus Platelet Rich Fibrin Utilizing Minimally Invasive Surgical Technique. A Randomized Clinical and Radiographic Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: Twenty-one intra-bony defects in fifteen systemically healthy patients with moderate to severe chronic periodontitis were randomly classified into 3 groups, 7 sites each. Group І treated by MIST alone, group ІІ treated by MIST + ethylenediamine-tetraaceticacid (EDTA) + PRF and group III treated by MIST + EDTA + GEM 21S. The clinical parameters including probing pocket depth (PPD), clinical attachment level (CAL) and bleeding on probing (BOP), were recorded at baseline, 3, 6 and 9 months post-surgery. Cone beam computed tomography (CBCT) was performed at baseline and 9 months post-surgery to evaluate bone level and bone density

detailed_description.textblock: : Twenty-one intra-bony defects in fifteen systemically healthy patients with moderate to severe chronic periodontitis were randomly classified into 3 groups, 7 sites each. Group І treated by MIST alone, group ІІ treated by MIST + ethylenediamine-tetraaceticacid (EDTA) + PRF and group III treated by MIST + EDTA + GEM 21S. The clinical parameters including probing pocket depth (PPD), clinical attachment level (CAL) and bleeding on probing (BOP), were recorded at baseline, 3, 6 and 9 months post-surgery. Cone beam computed tomography (CBCT) was performed at baseline and 9 months post-surgery to evaluate bone level and bone density.

primary_outcome.measure: the change in probing pocket depth
primary_outcome.description: the change in probing pocket depth was measured at baseline, 3,6 and 9 months evaluation period using periodontal probe

primary_outcome.measure: the change bleeding on probing score
primary_outcome.description: the change in bleeding on probing measured at baseline,3,6 and 9 months evaluation period
the change in Clinical attachment level measured at baseline, 3,6 and 9 months using the periodontal probe
Cone beam radiograph for measuring the change in area of the defect, depth of the depth and bone density at baseline, 3, 6 and 9 month post operative treatment using OnDemand software of cone beam

arm_group.arm_group_label: treated by using Minimally invasive flap only.
arm_group.description: 7 sites treated with Minimally invasive flap only

arm_group.arm_group_label: Minimally invasive flap with root conditioning (EDTA) and platelet rich fibrin .
arm_group.description: 7 sites treated with Minimally invasive flap plus EDTA root conditioning and application of platelet rich fibrin graft

arm_group.arm_group_label: MIST with root conditioning (EDTA) and GEM 21S .
arm_group.description: 7 sites treated with Minimally invasive flap plus EDTA root conditioning and application of growth factor enhanced matrix GEM21S

intervention.description: contained defect treated with Minimally invasive flap
intervention.arm_group_label: treated by using Minimally invasive flap only.

intervention.intervention_name: Minimally invasive flap with root conditioning (EDTA) and platelet rich fibrin
intervention.description: contained defect treated by Minimally invasive flap with root conditioning (EDTA) and platelet rich fibrin graft
intervention.arm_group_label: Minimally invasive flap with root conditioning (EDTA) and platelet rich fibrin .

intervention.intervention_name: minimally invasive flap with root contioning by EDTA and growth factor enhanced matrix GEM21S
intervention.description: contained defect treated with Minimally invasive flap with root conditioning (EDTA) and growth factor enhanced matrix application in the defect
intervention.arm_group_label: MIST with root conditioning (EDTA) and GEM 21S .

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
• Presence of at least one tooth with PPD and CAL loss of ≥ 5 mm associated with an intra-bony defect of ≥ 2 mm according to Cortellini and Tonetti, 2007
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with uncontrolled or poorly controlled diabetes, life-threatening conditions, or requiring antibiotic prophylaxis were excluded.
- Smokers
- Pregnant patients.
- Patients with aggressive periodontitis.
- Patients with multiple interconnected vertical defect walls.
